name: Aardwolf
description: The Aardwolf is a small, insectivorous hyena with a distinctive mane and striped coat.
spread_note: Found in East and Southern Africa, including Tanzania and South Africa.
food_note: Can consume thousands of termites in a single night.
proportions: Length: 55-80 cm, height: 40-50 cm, weight: 7-15 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 90 days, litters of 2-5 cubs.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to specialized diet, but fascinating for their unique ecology.
projects_note: Not endangered, but habitat loss is a concern.
breeding: Rarely bred in captivity due to dietary needs.
